description:
Description

As studio E-ggs' series for Miniforms has evolved, Shiko—a bed frame echoing the traditional Japanese tatami but raised on 4 legs—adds a headboard fashioned from solid wood and woven Vienna straw. Both lightweight and sturdy, it creates a light and airy environment while also lending a bit of playfulness. Named for the ritual exercise performed by sumo wrestlers to chase away evil spirits, the bed seems to evoke a similarly peaceful nocturnal mood.

name: Elizabeth Lounge Chair
description:
Description

With its majestic presence, the once named U-56 was more suitably dubbed Elizabeth Chair after Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip purchased a pair during an official visit to Denmark in 1958. The chair’s sculpted armrests combined with the leather- or fabric-upholstered low seat and sleigh-like back make it a prime example of Danish modern style from designer Ib Kofod-Larsen—sleek and well-proportioned, with a slender silhouette shaped using fine craftsmanship techniques.
